intro: Valeriana hirtella, commonly known as hairy valerian, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has a spreading habit with hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers, which are usually pink or white, bloom in the summer months. Valeriana hirtella is often used in herbal medicine for its calming properties.
